##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitmodelDetail"></a>6.5.2.16. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.modelDetail`

**Title:** modelDetail

|                        |                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or integer`                                                                                             |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [GeneratingUnit.modelDetail](#RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitmodelDetail) |

**Description:** Detail level of the generator model data.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitnominalP"></a>6.5.2.17. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.nominalP`

**Title:** nominalP

|                        |                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The nominal power of the generating unit.  Used to give precise meaning to percentage based attributes such as the governor speed change droop (governorSCD attribute).
The attribute shall be a positive value equal to or less than RotatingMachine.ratedS.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitnormalPF"></a>6.5.2.18. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.normalPF`

**Title:** normalPF

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Generating unit economic participation factor.  The sum of the participation factors across generating units does not have to sum to one.  It is used for representing distributed slack participation factor. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitpenaltyFactor"></a>6.5.2.19. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.penaltyFactor`

**Title:** penaltyFactor

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Defined as: 1 / ( 1 - Incremental Transmission Loss); with the Incremental Transmission Loss expressed as a plus or minus value. The typical range of penalty factors is (0.9 to 1.1).

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitraiseRampRate"></a>6.5.2.20. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.raiseRampRate`

**Title:** raiseRampRate

|                        |                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [GeneratingUnit.lowerRampRate](#RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitlowerRampRate) |

**Description:** The normal maximum rate the generating unit active power output can be raised by control actions.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitratedGrossMaxP"></a>6.5.2.21. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.ratedGrossMaxP`

**Title:** ratedGrossMaxP

|                        |                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The unit's gross rated maximum capacity (book value).
The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitratedGrossMinP"></a>6.5.2.22. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.ratedGrossMinP`

**Title:** ratedGrossMinP

|                        |                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The gross rated minimum generation level which the unit can safely operate at while delivering power to the transmission grid.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitratedNetMaxP"></a>6.5.2.23. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.ratedNetMaxP`

**Title:** ratedNetMaxP

|                        |                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The net rated maximum capacity determined by subtracting the auxiliary power used to operate the internal plant machinery from the rated gross maximum capacity.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitshortPF"></a>6.5.2.24. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.shortPF`

**Title:** shortPF

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Generating unit short term economic participation factor.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitstartupCost"></a>6.5.2.25. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.startupCost`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitstartupTime"></a>6.5.2.26. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.startupTime`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnittieLinePF"></a>6.5.2.27. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.tieLinePF`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>6.5.2.28. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > IdentifiedObject.description`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitvariableCost"></a>6.5.2.29. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.variableCost`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_Equipmentaggregate"></a>6.5.2.30. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to “true” the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>6.5.2.31. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnittotalEfficiency"></a>6.5.2.32. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.totalEfficiency`

**Title:** totalEfficiency

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [InefficientBatteryUnit.efficiencyDischarge](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge) |

**Description:** The efficiency of the unit in converting the fuel into electrical energy.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>6.5.2.33. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>6.5.2.34. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>6.5.2.35. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_EquipmentinService"></a>6.5.2.36. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitallocSpinResP"></a>6.5.2.37. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.allocSpinResP`

**Description:** The planned unused capacity (spinning reserve) which can be used to support emergency load.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitautoCntrlMarginP"></a>6.5.2.38. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.autoCntrlMarginP`

| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                        |

**Description:** The planned unused capacity which can be used to support automatic control overruns.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitbaseP"></a>6.5.2.39. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.baseP`

**Title:** baseP

|                        |                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** For dispatchable units, this value represents the economic active power basepoint, for units that are not dispatchable, this value represents the fixed generation value. The value shall be between the operating low and high limits.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitcontrolDeadband"></a>6.5.2.40. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.controlDeadband`

**Title:** controlDeadband

|                        |                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Unit control error deadband. When a unit's desired active power change is less than this deadband, then no control pulses will be sent to the unit.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitcontrolPulseHigh"></a>6.5.2.41. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.controlPulseHigh`

**Description:** Pulse high limit which is the largest control pulse that the unit can respond to.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitcontrolPulseLow"></a>6.5.2.42. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.controlPulseLow`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_GeneratingUnitefficiency"></a>6.5.2.44. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.efficiency`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>6.5.2.45. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > SolarGeneratingUnit > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpSchedule"></a>6.5.3.1. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpSchedule`

|                           |                                                                                                                             |
| ------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                                                                    |
| **Required**              | No                                                                                                                          |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.")                                                   |
| **Same definition as**    | [GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpSchedule](#RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpSchedule) |

**Description:** The generating unit's Operator-approved current operating schedule (or plan), typically produced with the aid of unit commitment type analyses. The X-axis represents absolute time. The Y1-axis represents the status (0=off-line and unavailable: 1=available: 2=must run: 3=must run at fixed power value: etc.). The Y2-axis represents the must run fixed power value where required.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpCostCurves"></a>6.5.3.2. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpCostCurves`

**Title:** GenUnitOpCostCurve

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |
| **Type**     | `array` |
| **Required** | No      |

**Description:** Relationship between unit operating cost (Y-axis) and unit output active power (X-axis). The operating cost curve for thermal units is derived from heat input and fuel costs. The operating cost curve for hydro units is derived from water flow rates and equivalent water costs.

|                      | Array restrictions |
| -------------------- | ------------------ |
| **Min items**        | N/A                |
| **Max items**        | N/A                |
| **Items unicity**    | False              |
| **Additional items** | False              |
| **Tuple validation** | See below          |

| Each item of this array must be                                                                                            | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [GenUnitOpCostCurve.json](#RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpCostCurves_items) | Relationship between unit operating cost (Y-axis) and unit output active power (X-axis). The operating cost curve for thermal units is derived from heat input and fuel costs. The operating cost curve for hydro units is derived from water flow rates and equivalent water costs. |

##### <a name="autogenerated_heading_18"></a>6.5.3.2.1. RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpCostCurves > GenUnitOpCostCurve.json

| ------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                                                              |
| **Required**              | No                                                                                                                    |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.")                                             |
| **Same definition as**    | [GenUnitOpCostCurve](#RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpCostCurves_items) |

**Description:** Relationship between unit operating cost (Y-axis) and unit output active power (X-axis). The operating cost curve for thermal units is derived from heat input and fuel costs. The operating cost curve for hydro units is derived from water flow rates and equivalent water costs.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitgovernorMPL"></a>6.5.3.3. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.governorMPL`

**Title:** governorMPL

|                        |                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.maxIFault](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionmaxIFault) |

**Description:** Governor motor position limit.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitgovernorSCD"></a>6.5.3.4. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.governorSCD`

**Title:** governorSCD

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [InefficientBatteryUnit.efficiencyDischarge](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge) |

**Description:** Governor Speed Changer Droop.   This is the change in generator power output divided by the change in frequency normalized by the nominal power of the generator and the nominal frequency and expressed in percent and negated. A positive value of speed change droop provides additional generator output upon a drop in frequency.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnithighControlLimit"></a>6.5.3.5. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.highControlLimit`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitnominalP"></a>6.5.3.17. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.nominalP`

**Title:** nominalP

|                        |                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The nominal power of the generating unit.  Used to give precise meaning to percentage based attributes such as the governor speed change droop (governorSCD attribute).
The attribute shall be a positive value equal to or less than RotatingMachine.ratedS.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitnormalPF"></a>6.5.3.18. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.normalPF`

**Title:** normalPF

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Generating unit economic participation factor.  The sum of the participation factors across generating units does not have to sum to one.  It is used for representing distributed slack participation factor. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitpenaltyFactor"></a>6.5.3.19. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.penaltyFactor`

**Title:** penaltyFactor

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Defined as: 1 / ( 1 - Incremental Transmission Loss); with the Incremental Transmission Loss expressed as a plus or minus value. The typical range of penalty factors is (0.9 to 1.1).

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitraiseRampRate"></a>6.5.3.20. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.raiseRampRate`

**Title:** raiseRampRate

|                        |                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [GeneratingUnit.lowerRampRate](#RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitlowerRampRate) |

**Description:** The normal maximum rate the generating unit active power output can be raised by control actions.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitratedGrossMaxP"></a>6.5.3.21. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.ratedGrossMaxP`

|                        |                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The unit's gross rated maximum capacity (book value).
The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitratedGrossMinP"></a>6.5.3.22. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.ratedGrossMinP`

**Description:** The gross rated minimum generation level which the unit can safely operate at while delivering power to the transmission grid.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitratedNetMaxP"></a>6.5.3.23. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.ratedNetMaxP`

|                        |                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The net rated maximum capacity determined by subtracting the auxiliary power used to operate the internal plant machinery from the rated gross maximum capacity.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitshortPF"></a>6.5.3.24. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.shortPF`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitvariableCost"></a>6.5.3.29. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.variableCost`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_Equipmentaggregate"></a>6.5.3.30. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to “true” the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>6.5.3.31. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnittotalEfficiency"></a>6.5.3.32. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.totalEfficiency`

**Title:** totalEfficiency

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [InefficientBatteryUnit.efficiencyDischarge](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge) |

**Description:** The efficiency of the unit in converting the fuel into electrical energy.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>6.5.3.33. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>6.5.3.34. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>6.5.3.35. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_EquipmentinService"></a>6.5.3.36. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitallocSpinResP"></a>6.5.3.37. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.allocSpinResP`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitautoCntrlMarginP"></a>6.5.3.38. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.autoCntrlMarginP`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitbaseP"></a>6.5.3.39. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.baseP`

**Title:** baseP

|                        |                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** For dispatchable units, this value represents the economic active power basepoint, for units that are not dispatchable, this value represents the fixed generation value. The value shall be between the operating low and high limits.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitcontrolDeadband"></a>6.5.3.40. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.controlDeadband`

**Title:** controlDeadband

|                        |                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Unit control error deadband. When a unit's desired active power change is less than this deadband, then no control pulses will be sent to the unit.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitcontrolPulseHigh"></a>6.5.3.41. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.controlPulseHigh`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_GeneratingUnitefficiency"></a>6.5.3.44. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.efficiency`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>6.5.3.45. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > NuclearGeneratingUnit > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpSchedule"></a>6.5.4.1. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpSchedule`

|                           |                                                                                                                             |
| ------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                                                                    |
| **Required**              | No                                                                                                                          |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.")                                                   |
| **Same definition as**    | [GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpSchedule](#RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpSchedule) |

**Description:** The generating unit's Operator-approved current operating schedule (or plan), typically produced with the aid of unit commitment type analyses. The X-axis represents absolute time. The Y1-axis represents the status (0=off-line and unavailable: 1=available: 2=must run: 3=must run at fixed power value: etc.). The Y2-axis represents the must run fixed power value where required.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpCostCurves"></a>6.5.4.2. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpCostCurves`

**Title:** GenUnitOpCostCurve

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |
| **Type**     | `array` |
| **Required** | No      |

**Description:** Relationship between unit operating cost (Y-axis) and unit output active power (X-axis). The operating cost curve for thermal units is derived from heat input and fuel costs. The operating cost curve for hydro units is derived from water flow rates and equivalent water costs.

|                      | Array restrictions |
| -------------------- | ------------------ |
| **Min items**        | N/A                |
| **Max items**        | N/A                |
| **Items unicity**    | False              |
| **Additional items** | False              |
| **Tuple validation** | See below          |

| Each item of this array must be                                                                                            | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [GenUnitOpCostCurve.json](#RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpCostCurves_items) | Relationship between unit operating cost (Y-axis) and unit output active power (X-axis). The operating cost curve for thermal units is derived from heat input and fuel costs. The operating cost curve for hydro units is derived from water flow rates and equivalent water costs. |

##### <a name="autogenerated_heading_19"></a>6.5.4.2.1. RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpCostCurves > GenUnitOpCostCurve.json

| ------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                                                              |
| **Required**              | No                                                                                                                    |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.")                                             |
| **Same definition as**    | [GenUnitOpCostCurve](#RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpCostCurves_items) |

**Description:** Relationship between unit operating cost (Y-axis) and unit output active power (X-axis). The operating cost curve for thermal units is derived from heat input and fuel costs. The operating cost curve for hydro units is derived from water flow rates and equivalent water costs.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitgovernorMPL"></a>6.5.4.3. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.governorMPL`

**Title:** governorMPL

|                        |                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.maxIFault](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionmaxIFault) |

**Description:** Governor motor position limit.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitgovernorSCD"></a>6.5.4.4. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.governorSCD`

**Title:** governorSCD

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [InefficientBatteryUnit.efficiencyDischarge](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge) |

**Description:** Governor Speed Changer Droop.   This is the change in generator power output divided by the change in frequency normalized by the nominal power of the generator and the nominal frequency and expressed in percent and negated. A positive value of speed change droop provides additional generator output upon a drop in frequency.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnithighControlLimit"></a>6.5.4.5. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.highControlLimit`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitnominalP"></a>6.5.4.17. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.nominalP`

**Title:** nominalP

|                        |                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The nominal power of the generating unit.  Used to give precise meaning to percentage based attributes such as the governor speed change droop (governorSCD attribute).
The attribute shall be a positive value equal to or less than RotatingMachine.ratedS.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitnormalPF"></a>6.5.4.18. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.normalPF`

**Title:** normalPF

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Generating unit economic participation factor.  The sum of the participation factors across generating units does not have to sum to one.  It is used for representing distributed slack participation factor. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitpenaltyFactor"></a>6.5.4.19. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.penaltyFactor`

**Title:** penaltyFactor

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Defined as: 1 / ( 1 - Incremental Transmission Loss); with the Incremental Transmission Loss expressed as a plus or minus value. The typical range of penalty factors is (0.9 to 1.1).

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitraiseRampRate"></a>6.5.4.20. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.raiseRampRate`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitratedGrossMaxP"></a>6.5.4.21. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.ratedGrossMaxP`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitratedGrossMinP"></a>6.5.4.22. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.ratedGrossMinP`

|                        |                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The gross rated minimum generation level which the unit can safely operate at while delivering power to the transmission grid.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitratedNetMaxP"></a>6.5.4.23. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.ratedNetMaxP`

**Title:** ratedNetMaxP

|                        |                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The net rated maximum capacity determined by subtracting the auxiliary power used to operate the internal plant machinery from the rated gross maximum capacity.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitshortPF"></a>6.5.4.24. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.shortPF`

**Title:** shortPF

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Generating unit short term economic participation factor.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitstartupCost"></a>6.5.4.25. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.startupCost`

| **Same definition as**    | [GeneratingUnit.startupCost](#RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitstartupCost) |

**Description:** The initial startup cost incurred for each start of the GeneratingUnit.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitstartupTime"></a>6.5.4.26. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.startupTime`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitvariableCost"></a>6.5.4.29. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.variableCost`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_Equipmentaggregate"></a>6.5.4.30. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to “true” the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>6.5.4.31. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnittotalEfficiency"></a>6.5.4.32. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.totalEfficiency`

**Title:** totalEfficiency

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [InefficientBatteryUnit.efficiencyDischarge](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge) |

**Description:** The efficiency of the unit in converting the fuel into electrical energy.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>6.5.4.33. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_WindGeneratingUnitwindGenUnitType"></a>6.5.4.34. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > WindGeneratingUnit.windGenUnitType`

**Title:** windGenUnitType

|                |                        |
| -------------- | ---------------------- |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)`     |
| **Required**   | No                     |
| **Defined in** | ./WindGenUnitKind.json |

**Description:** The kind of wind generating unit.

Must be one of:
* "offshore"
* "onshore"

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>6.5.4.35. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>6.5.4.36. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_EquipmentinService"></a>6.5.4.37. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitallocSpinResP"></a>6.5.4.38. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.allocSpinResP`

|                        |                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitautoCntrlMarginP"></a>6.5.4.39. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.autoCntrlMarginP`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitbaseP"></a>6.5.4.40. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.baseP`

**Title:** baseP

|                        |                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** For dispatchable units, this value represents the economic active power basepoint, for units that are not dispatchable, this value represents the fixed generation value. The value shall be between the operating low and high limits.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitcontrolDeadband"></a>6.5.4.41. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.controlDeadband`

**Title:** controlDeadband

|                        |                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Unit control error deadband. When a unit's desired active power change is less than this deadband, then no control pulses will be sent to the unit.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitcontrolPulseHigh"></a>6.5.4.42. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.controlPulseHigh`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitcontrolResponseRate"></a>6.5.4.44. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.controlResponseRate`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitefficiency"></a>6.5.4.45. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.efficiency`

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>6.5.4.46. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpSchedule"></a>6.5.5.1. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpSchedule`

|                           |                                                                                                                             |
| ------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                                                                    |
| **Required**              | No                                                                                                                          |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.")                                                   |
| **Same definition as**    | [GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpSchedule](#RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpSchedule) |

**Description:** The generating unit's Operator-approved current operating schedule (or plan), typically produced with the aid of unit commitment type analyses. The X-axis represents absolute time. The Y1-axis represents the status (0=off-line and unavailable: 1=available: 2=must run: 3=must run at fixed power value: etc.). The Y2-axis represents the must run fixed power value where required.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpCostCurves"></a>6.5.5.2. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpCostCurves`

**Title:** GenUnitOpCostCurve

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |
| **Type**     | `array` |
| **Required** | No      |

**Description:** Relationship between unit operating cost (Y-axis) and unit output active power (X-axis). The operating cost curve for thermal units is derived from heat input and fuel costs. The operating cost curve for hydro units is derived from water flow rates and equivalent water costs.

|                      | Array restrictions |
| -------------------- | ------------------ |
| **Min items**        | N/A                |
| **Max items**        | N/A                |
| **Items unicity**    | False              |
| **Additional items** | False              |
| **Tuple validation** | See below          |

| Each item of this array must be                                                                                            | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [GenUnitOpCostCurve.json](#RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpCostCurves_items) | Relationship between unit operating cost (Y-axis) and unit output active power (X-axis). The operating cost curve for thermal units is derived from heat input and fuel costs. The operating cost curve for hydro units is derived from water flow rates and equivalent water costs. |

##### <a name="autogenerated_heading_20"></a>6.5.5.2.1. RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpCostCurves > GenUnitOpCostCurve.json

**Description:** Relationship between unit operating cost (Y-axis) and unit output active power (X-axis). The operating cost curve for thermal units is derived from heat input and fuel costs. The operating cost curve for hydro units is derived from water flow rates and equivalent water costs.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitgovernorMPL"></a>6.5.5.3. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.governorMPL`

**Title:** governorMPL

|                        |                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.maxIFault](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionmaxIFault) |

**Description:** Governor motor position limit.

##### <a name="RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitgovernorSCD"></a>6.5.5.4. Property `RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.governorSCD`

**Title:** governorSCD

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [InefficientBatteryUnit.efficiencyDischarge](#PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge) |

**Description:** Governor Speed Changer Droop.   This is the change in generator power output divided by the change in frequency normalized by the nominal power of the generator and the nominal frequency and expressed in percent and negated. A positive value of speed change droop provides additional generator output upon a drop in frequency.
